alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kenton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, CENTRAL BOONE AND NORTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located near Independence, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Independence, Walton, Claryville, Ryland Heights, Visalia, Atwood, Richwood, Grants Lick, Aspen Grove, Bank Lick, Morning View, Gubser Mill, Gardnersville, White Villa, Campbell County Lake, Fiskburg, Ricedale, Piner, and White Tower. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 174 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
